Class DateTimeLeap

java.lang.Object
DateTimeLeap
public class DateTimeLeap extends Object
This class reads in the SimpleDates.txt and then stores it into a HashMap. Then checks if the year is a leap year or not and prints out the date and its corresponding sentence depending on this. Also prints out the entire HashMap before sorting and then after
Version:
1
Author:
Diego Cifuentes

  • Constructor Details

  • Method Details

    • compareYear

      public void compareYear()
      Reads in the SimpleDate.txt file and then stores it into a HashMap. Then checks if the year is a leap year or not and then prints out if it is one or not. Also prints out the difference of the given year from the file and today's date.

    • dateHashMap

      public void dateHashMap()
      Goes through the HashMap and prints out with the given format

    • dateHashMapSort

      public void dateHashMapSort()
      Sorts the HashMap using a TreeMap and then uses similar logic as the dateHashMap() method and prints out the TreeMap
